Ow 2 is just a cancer game that makes me wanna kill my self. And the community is such cancer too. Ow 1> Ow 2. 

I have spoken.
this game is so bad -1000h of my life

I paid for this game in 2019 only for the game I enjoyed to go down the drain.

Being on steam is nice, sure, but the reason they put this game on steam is utterly pathetic. 

They didn't do it so it makes it easier to play with friends. Or if you don't have your battle.net app installed. Or whatever reason.

They just added Overwatch on steam just because it is bleeding players. Why else would they put a free to play game on steam? The worst part? It's self inflicted too. They ruined the game I and many players enjoyed and blizzard could do the right thing, but they would rather die on this hill, or more specifically, the own hole they dug.

All the player feedback is useless. Their philosophy is "we know what you want better than you do"

Another reason this game is here is because of blizzard's continued strugglers and underperformance. Battle.net houses some of the fastest and best selling PC titles of all times. If there existed a single developer that didn't need steam, it was blizzard.

So this is just an attempt to secure more players for a game that is in decline. 


Just go play paladins at least the developers there care about the game.

They got rid of the perfectly fine old game and replaced it with a new game, making it worse and promising to add this huge PvE expansion. Turns out the developers slept for the last 3 years and so now it is ass.

CreÃ­ que el porno que subÃ­an a internet eran cinemÃ¡ticas del juego.

Vaya mierda de juego, btw

Run away from this joke of a game. Blizzard has completely shat on it's community.

They promessed us a fresh new game to dig Overwatch 1 out of the grave but all they have done is transforming the game from 6v6 to 5v5 + new ways to make us spit a ton of money. And the biggest joke of it all is that it took them almost 3 years to do that.

The main reason to play OW2 was their PVE mode which has been canceled and the current PVE mode is 15.- (without counting the battlepass).

If you want a good game, really F2P that looks like it, go on Paladins you'll have much more fun.

I play Competitive and Quick Play only so i'll talk about this in the review.

The competitive experience is extremely frustrating, they have had 11 months to try and "fix" the and it only gets worse as each month progresses. There has been multiple attempts to try and add what we think would be best for the game however it seems like it is never listened to.

The hero balance has become more and more low skilled with the philosophy trending towards a button to get out of jail free card in every fight, this leaves a big gap between high and low skilled heroes; to the point where you have to have twice the skill to achieve the same goal as you once had to win team fights.  This leads to me feeling bored halfway through a match and to be honest I don't even play competitive anymore.  This game DOES NOT reward you for picking harder characters and incentives you to swap every 30 seconds in order to win rather than using skill. (Diamond 1 on rein)

The Quick Play experience has become far more competitive than it ought to be, you might as well play competitive because it has become a stomping ground for high rank players to complete their Battle Passes.  In the past 2 weeks I haven't been able to complete a single Quick Play match without someone leaving sometimes its 2 or more. 

As a community we have literally begged the developers of Overwatch to communicate with us showing us that they are listening to us and understand our frustrations with the game and time after time we are told that we are "hostile and ungrateful" for the work they have put into the game.  

Finally, its good to actually have a place to conclude my experiences with Overwatch along with everyone else, I know i'm just as disgruntled as the rest of you and hopefully blizzard can extend an olive branch to us within the next year but we'll see.  Right now i'm feeling very bitter about the whole Overwatch 2 experience.

Finally on steam instead of the horrible Battle.net launcher..
But they butchered the game with their greed and mismanagement.

Locking heroes behind a paywall in a game that is focused on counter picks throughout the game, bad choice.
Also constantly cancel promises and worst of all the shutdown a perfectly good game for this money grab.

Until these things changes, I cannot recommend the game, although I have been a fan of this for many years, I hope leadership will change soon and they can manage to bring this game back to life, by then I will change my review.
this game is more dog shit than your local dog park

An improvement over Overwatch 1. 5v5 is faster paced and each role is more meaningful than 6v6. I enjoy the new modes and getting multiple new heroes, maps, and modes, every year, unlike OW1. The Shop is expensive but anythign is better than Loot Box gambling addition crap. And the PvE Content, while smaller than I'd like, is good. I am enjoying the minute to minute gameplay and excited for more heroes, PvE, and updates.

cant even launch the game, smh

Such a great game that has been buried under poor balancing, bugs, content droughts, price gouging, micro-transactions, and broken promises. This game works well as a casual party game to play with friends over a discord call late at night, but that is only if you ignore the hellscape that is competitive. Toxicity runs rampant through the community, with racism and homophobia seemingly going unpunished, and every other game has it's chat filled with "Diff." Seasonal content is pushed into the game at such an extremely slow rate, and even then it feels incomplete. With new characters locked behind battlepasses and an item shop shoved into your face at every corner, it is not hard to feel that Blizzard simply cares about the endless profit they will gain from this game. The hollow excuse for PVE isn't worth playing, and the arcade is only somewhat fun for about 10 minutes. I would only recommend this game to people looking for something to play in boredom with friends. Beyond that, STAY AWAY FROM THIS GAME.

After experiencing the proxy incident, the former white experts have transformed into two factions. One faction is the radical faction, who crazily accuse Blizzard of its barbaric behavior; The other faction is the conservatives, who believe that the rhetoric of the radicals is not strong enough. Blizzard is a fool, and Bobby Kotick whole family has died suddenly.
